lexUnit.name: cease.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: come or bring to an end; stop.

sentence.text: The mill was eventually forced to cease operations during Mr Bright 's time when a large pond , further upstream , was drained by a colliery to reduce water leakage into the coal workings .
A number of training providers are likely to cease their activities . "
It also called on the guerrillas in El Salvador to cease hostilities and to begin peace talks .
It 's not that he ceases altogether to be the eternal student , but that he becomes reshaped and misshaped into an aberration .
They were ceasing to be the almost monastic institutions of the past .
Between September 1939 and June 1941 the Left almost ceased to exist as a unified force .
That role made possible his nomination ; he was elected as an outsider and , by his own admission , he never ceased being one whilst in office .
The Almighty was something of an embarrassment to the BBC of late , ever since He had ceased to be the exclusive property of the Church of England .
She soon fell victim , and ceased to show any signs of life .
Even after he had ceased to be a Neoplatonist , St Augustine remained very much under the influence of Plato 's philosophical ideas , in particular those concerning time .

As relations deteriorated , Russia ceased to favour the eventual union of Bulgaria and Roumelia , and forced Prince Alexander of Bulgaria , nominally an autocrat , to accept Russian generals as ministers .
Once we attain the transcendental standpoint , we have ceased to carry with us the substantive concept of truth required to raise epistemological questions .
Also , in October 1949 , the Communists ' who had been fighting in the Greek Civil War , ceased fighting .
Following his daughter 's death , Hugo ceased writing for several years .
As the south of Britain became hostile territory , the Scots ceased to be north Britons , and became enthusiastic Europeans .
People cease to cough or sniff or shuffle their feet .
At Surrey the ` amateur " W. W. Read was employed as ` assistant secretary " to the club for £250 a year -- a post he relinquished when he ceased to play .
At intervals he ceased his frenzied pacing and peered up and down the hideous pipe , as if expecting the arrival of some fellow conspirator .
Soap ceased his fantastic monologue , and Pooley and Omally stared at him dumb and slack-jawed .
In October 1991 the company ceased trading in the United Kingdom and its business , assets and liabilities there were transferred to a United Kingdom company .
ISLAND GRAPHICS CEASES TO SELL DIRECTLY TO RESELLERS
` I will not cease to wrestle for the salvation of your immortal soul . "
Gilbert ceased struggling , realising that Cardiff would not let him go until he knew more .
She herself had long ceased to believe in Father Christmas and fairy-tales .
